item.title: U.S. Data Supports Dollar Ahead of Fed Meeting
item.description: The dollar could rise further after the strong U.S. non-farm payrolls data caused markets to reduce expectations of interest-rate cuts by the Federal Reserve even more ahead of a meeting this week, MUFG said.

item.title: Oil Edges Higher But Bearish Sentiment Persists
item.description: Oil prices edged higher in early European trading Monday despite a stronger dollar, but market sentiment remains broadly bearish, ING said.

item.title: European Stocks Drop After EU Election
item.description: European stock indexes fell after far-right parties’ advanced in European Union elections, with the CAC 40 retreating 1.6% as Emmanuel Macron called a legislative election after Marine Le Pen’s party trounced his forces.

item.title: Gold Prices Drop on U.S. Jobs Data, Waning Chinese Enthusiasm
item.description: Gold futures fell to their lowest level since early April on a stronger-than-expected U.S. jobs report and on news that China halted buying gold for reserves in May, ING said.

item.title: European Stocks and Euro Hit by Political Instability
item.description: European stock markets and the euro fell following the advance of far-right parties in European elections and major losses for President Emmanuel Macron’s alliance that prompted him to call a snap election.

item.title: French Bond Market Could See Nervousness Due to Early Elections
item.description: The next few weeks could see some nervousness on the French debt market as France heads into early legislative elections, following far-right advance in European elections and major losses for Emmanuel Macron’s alliance, Natixis said.

item.title: How Israel Saved a Hostage Rescue Mission That Nearly Failed
item.description: Israel called in heavy airstrikes to support an operation that had a “thin line between being a huge success and a huge failure.”

item.title: Iran approved six candidates, almost all conservatives, to run in a presidential contest on June 28 following the death of President Ebrahim Raisi last month.
item.description: Iran approved six candidates, almost all conservatives, to run in a presidential contest on June 28 following the death of President Ebrahim Raisi last month.

item.title: The Biden administration is close to completing a treaty with Saudi Arabia that would commit the U.S. to help defend the Gulf nation as part of a long-shot deal to encouragediplomatic ties between Riyadh and Israel.
item.description: The Biden administration is close to completing a treaty with Saudi Arabia that would commit the U.S. to help defend the Gulf nation as part of a long-shot deal to encourage diplomatic ties between Riyadh and Israel.

item.title: Right-wing parties put on a show of strength in European Union elections, prompting France's president to call national elections and underscoring the German chancellor's position lagging two rival parties, according to initial projections.
item.description: Right-wing parties put on a show of strength in European Union elections, prompting France’s president to call national elections and underscoring the German chancellor’s position lagging two rival parties, according to initial projections.

item.title: A large section of a mountain highway linking Idaho and Wyoming collapsed after a landslide, closing the Teton Pass indefinitely, officials said.
item.description: A large section of a mountain highway linking Idaho and Wyoming collapsed after a landslide, closing the Teton Pass indefinitely, officials said.

item.title: Internal fissures and external pressure have intensified at the Supreme Court as it heads to the end of the current term, with pending cases that could remake the presidential election and with ethical questions dogging some of its members.
item.description: Internal fissures and external pressure have intensified at the Supreme Court as it heads to the end of the current term, with pending cases that could remake the presidential election and with ethical questions dogging some of its members.

item.title: Countries around the globe are pouring billions of dollars into new domestic computing facilities for artificial intelligence, stimulating a rapidly growing source of sales for Nvidia and other tech companies.
item.description: Countries around the globe are pouring billions of dollars into new domestic computing facilities for artificial intelligence, stimulating a rapidly growing source of sales for Nvidia and other tech companies.

item.title: Benny Gantz, a centrist member of Israel's war cabinet, quit the government over Netanyahu's handling of the war in Gaza, after a daring Israeli commando mission to rescue four hostages threatened to trip up efforts to end the conflict and free the remaining captives.
item.description: Benny Gantz, a centrist member of Israel’s war cabinet, quit the government over Netanyahu’s handling of the war in Gaza, after a daring Israeli commando mission to rescue four hostages threatened to trip up efforts to end the conflict and free the remaining captives.

item.title: The Fed is expected to hold interest rates steady at the highest level in more than two decades when policymakers wrap up a two-day meeting Wednesday, extending the fight against inflation.
item.description: The Fed is expected to hold interest rates steady at the highest level in more than two decades when policymakers wrap up a two-day meeting Wednesday, extending the fight against inflation.

item.title: Tesla faces a $25 billion question mark over the cost of reviving CEO Elon Musk's pay package when shareholders vote on the matter at the company's annual meeting this week.
item.description: Tesla faces a $25 billion question mark over the cost of reviving CEO Elon Musk’s pay package when shareholders vote on the matter at the company’s annual meeting this week.

item.title: Nordic Capital disclosed the sale of Sunrise Medical to Platinum Equity, a deal that ended plans for an initial public offering of the German wheelchair maker.
item.description: Nordic Capital disclosed the sale of Sunrise Medical to Platinum Equity, a deal that ended plans for an initial public offering of the German wheelchair maker.

item.title: Elliott Investment Management has built a stake of nearly $2 billion in Southwest and plans to push for changes aimed at reversing the airline's underperformance.
item.description: Elliott Investment Management has built a stake of nearly $2 billion in Southwest and plans to push for changes aimed at reversing the airline’s underperformance.

item.title: Alphabet and Google's new chief financial officer, Anat Ashkenazi, is slated to receive a signing bonus of $9.9 million and an annual base salary of $1 million.
item.description: Alphabet and Google’s new chief financial officer, Anat Ashkenazi, is slated to receive a signing bonus of $9.9 million and an annual base salary of $1 million.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide
